translation.eng: Now, I will talk about why we Indians changed.
This is caused because we stopped disciplining.
Younger generation calls it “scolding” when you discipline them.

transcript.default: ʔatqʷin, qʷiyuyin niiw̓a ƛ̓aqaa naʔaataḥʔaƛqʷin ʔiʔiqḥʷat.

transcription.default: ʔatqʷin qʷiyuyin niiw̓a ƛ̓aqaa naʔaataḥʔaƛqʷin ʔiʔiqḥʷat

translation.eng: Although when we were growing up, we used to listen to them what they told us repeatedly.
I always think a lot about the way my grandmother used to talk to us.
I also stopped hearing [their teachings as I started going to school].
She would tell me, “You would be like this when you get husband; you won’t do this.”

transcript.default: ʔaanapanač̓iƛqʷin ḥuu yaacpanač, ʔaaƛapanač ʔuyaaʔatquus ʔaḥʔaa ciiqciiqat.

transcription.default: ʔaanapanač̓iƛqʷin ḥuu yaacpanač ʔaaƛapanač ʔuyaaʔatquus ʔaḥʔaa ciiqciiqat

translation.eng: We would go off by ourselves for a walk — just two of us. That is the time when she would talk to me.

transcript.default: čuu ʔaḥʔaa ʔuy̓inƛniš quuʔasqin ʔan wikiičiƛ ƛaaḥaqsak naʔaa wikiičiƛ ḥaaḥuupa ʔaʔiič̓um.

transcription.default: čuu ʔaḥʔaa ʔuy̓inƛniš quuʔasqin ʔan wikiičiƛ ƛaaḥaqsak naʔaa wikiičiƛ ḥaaḥuupa ʔaʔiič̓um

translation.eng: Now, we Indians have this problem because younger generation have stopped listening and elders stop disciplining.

transcript.default: ʔaanaḥiičiƛ̓aɬ ƛaaḥaqsak, wawaamitʔickƛa wawaa. y̓uuqʷaamitʔick qʷaa.

transcription.default: ʔaanaḥiičiƛ̓aɬ ƛaaḥaqsak wawaamitʔickƛa wawaa y̓uuqʷaamitʔick qʷaa

translation.eng: Younger people just say, “You told that to me before. You are like that, too.”
This is how they talk now.
This is because the elders started drinking.
Now, this is why we Indians changed.
We stopped doing what our grandparents used to do.
It is important to discipline and discipline repeatedly.
